headline: Kaos Season 2: Creator reveals what to expect from the Greek mythology series
paragraph: Charlie Covell, the creator of series Kaos, has shared an update on the possibility of a second season.

headline: Deloitte, top executive part ways over 'conflict of interest'
paragraph: Replying to ET's emailed queries, Khanna confirmed that Deloitte and he had parted ways. "I am starting a new journey by joining the well established family business, which acquires real estate assets to turn them around financially. This has no conflict with Deloitte as Deloitte is not a real estate investment company...We have a very unique business model... Our model is based on asset acquisition through transparent bidding, in most cases overseen by NCLT. The business is growing rapidly, thanks to rapid urbanisation and the burgeoning middle class. I foresee many opportunities to expand it nationally," he said.

headline: Top 15-Litre Geysers in India: Efficient Heating Solutions for Your Home
paragraph: In this article, we invite you to explore a curated selection of the latest 15-litre geysers and water heaters, designed to provide you with a steady supply of hot water whenever you need it. From energy-efficient models to those featuring advanced safety and durability features, these trendy water heaters combine style and functionality to enhance your daily comfort. Dive into our guide to find the perfect solution that fits your needs and elevates your home experience.

headline: Grace Season 5: Release date, returning cast, episode details & more
paragraph: The crime thriller Grace has impressed audiences with its compelling storylines and exceptional performances. The show's ongoing success has resulted in the announcement of its fifth season

headline: ET Graphics: A big connection with mobile Data
paragraph: Low data rates have sharply boosted data usage levels over the years with India’s average monthly data usage (AMDU) per subscriber having more than doubled to almost 26 GB in Q1FY25 from 11 GB in Q2FY20.

headline: Aim to shift a third of trucks to LNG in 5-7 Years: Oil Ministry
paragraph: The Indian government aims to have liquefied natural gas (LNG) power a third of the country's long-haul heavy-duty vehicle fleet within 5-7 years, with plans to use domestic gas for this initiative. The proposal includes stabilizing LNG prices by allocating 0.5 million metric standard cubic meters per day of domestic gas for the next three years, sufficient to support 50,000 trucks.

headline: These Sun belt states could be key to Kamala Harris' potential victory in U.S Presidential elections
paragraph: Kamala Harris is closing the distance with Donald Trump by making notable gains in important Sun Belt states. The electorate has changed as a result of her campaign's momentum and deliberate emphasis on swing states, raising Democratic expectations for a possible 2024 victory.

headline: India pips US to become 2nd largest 5G smartphone market
paragraph: India has surpassed the US to become the second-largest market for 5G smartphones after China in early 2024, driven by affordable models from Xiaomi, Vivo, and Samsung, according to Counterpoint Research. Global 5G smartphone shipments grew 20% year-on-year in the first half of 2024.

headline: All schools to remain closed in Manipur after bomb attacks in Bishnupur district
paragraph: On Friday, the Manipur government announced that schools will be closed on September 7 due to unrest caused by recent bomb attacks in Bishnupur district. The Directorate of Education (Schools) issued a notification stating that all government, private, and central schools across the state will remain closed to ensure the safety of students and teachers. The notification cited the current unrest and prevailing conditions as the reasons for this precautionary measure.

headline: Protests in Bangladesh against radicals demanding new anthem and flag
paragraph: Udichi Shilpi Gosthi organized a nationwide protest in Bangladesh against radicals demanding a new national anthem and flag. In Dhaka, members sang the current anthem by Rabindranath Tagore. The group vowed to resist any conspiracies against the anthem, flag, or Liberation War achievements.

headline: India plans to host Abu Dhabi crown prince next week
paragraph: India will host Abu Dhabi's crown prince, Sheikh Khaled bin Mohammed bin Zayed Al Nahyan, next week to strengthen ties with the UAE. Sheikh Khaled recently inaugurated IIT Delhi's Abu Dhabi campus, marking a significant step in India-UAE relations. The UAE has become a crucial partner in India's Gulf outreach through various strategic initiatives.

headline: Medical devices cos asked to adopt uniform marketing code
paragraph: The government has mandated medical devices associations to adopt a uniform marketing code similar to that for pharmaceuticals. This includes prohibitions on organizing workshops abroad and offering expensive perks to healthcare professionals. Companies must upload the code on their websites and form an Ethics Committee for Marketing Practices.

headline: Here are the rules released by ABC for the September 10 Trump vs. Harris U.S. presidential debate
paragraph: After President Biden withdrew from the race, ABC News will host the first debate between Donald Trump and Kamala Harris on September 10.

headline: After drone bombs, rocket attacks in Manipur; 1 Killed
paragraph: One person was killed and five injured in Manipur's Bishnupur district after suspected militants fired two rockets. Security forces are on high alert following recent high-tech attacks, including drone bombings. The rockets were believed to target the Indian National Army Museum in Moirang town, falling just 100 meters away.

headline: Mirwaiz Umar Farooq put under house arrest yet again, he says it's 'disconcerting and negative'
paragraph: Hurriyat leader Mirwaiz Umar Farooq has been placed under house arrest again, preventing him from addressing the Friday congregation at Jama Masjid in Srinagar. He expressed concerns about being detained until the end of the assembly elections and criticized the use of force to maintain peace and normalcy in Jammu and Kashmir.

headline: John Cockerill and Greenko to invest ₹2,800 crore on their electrolyser manufacturing facility
paragraph: John Cockerill Group and Greenko Group will invest ₹2,800 crore in an electrolyser manufacturing facility in Kakinada, Andhra Pradesh. The plant aims to produce 2 gigawatts of electrolysers annually and serve as an export hub. The venture also plans to expand into steel, energy, and defence sectors, tripling its workforce in two years.

headline: Telcos roll out festive offers to retain top prepaid users
paragraph: The latest battle to retain high-value prepaid users between India's top three telcos comes even as loss-making Vi itself is struggling to hold onto its own users. Vi's stock plunged almost 11.5% to close at Rs 13.36 on the BSE on Friday, just days after its revenue market share (RMS) plummeted to an all-time low of 15% in the fiscal first quarter, as per latest data collated by the telecom regulator.

headline: J&K polls: Omar Abdullah smells 'conspiracy' against him from Delhi
paragraph: Omar Abdullah, National Conference vice president, claims that leaders in New Delhi dislike and conspire against him. He believes this is due to his representation of Jammu and Kashmir's aspirations. Abdullah cites the acceptance of jailed candidates' nominations against him as evidence of a conspiracy by the BJP to silence him.

headline: Coca-Cola global EVP Henrique Braun reveals co's growth strategy for India
paragraph: Coca-Cola is segmenting India into clusters to identify areas with faster growth potential. The company sees India as a key market with significant growth opportunities despite uneven recovery trends post-pandemic. Coca-Cola India's revenue and profit saw substantial increases in FY23, reflecting strong market performance.

headline: Panama deports 130 Indians to New Delhi under US repatriations deal
paragraph: Panama has deported 130 Indian migrants who entered the country through the Darien jungle, under a repatriation deal with the United States. This marks the first expulsion outside of the Americas under this agreement. The US has pledged $6 million to assist Panama in reducing irregular migration.

headline: Best Grill Microwaves in India for All-Round Cooking
paragraph: Grill microwave ovens are gaining popularity in Indian households for their dual functionality of grilling and microwave cooking. This article reviews the best options available in India based on capacity, features, and price range. It serves as a guide for readers to find the perfect appliance that suits their culinary needs and budget.

headline: Beetlejuice Beetlejuice: Is the Tim Burton sequel available on streaming?
paragraph: The long-awaited sequel to Tim Burton's iconic 1988 film, Beetlejuice, has finally arrived, and fans are excited to once again experience the antics of the mischievous demon in Beetlejuice Beetlejuice.

headline: J&K polls: Article 370 is history, no one can bring it back, says Amit Shah
paragraph: Union Home Minister Amit Shah declared that Article 370 is history and cannot be reinstated. He emphasized that India will not engage in talks with Pakistan until terrorism ends. Shah also discussed BJP's manifesto for Jammu and Kashmir, ruling out alliances with PDP, NC, and Congress, and highlighted efforts towards the rehabilitation of Kashmiri Pandits.

headline: Bluey minisodes to arrive on this date: Release date, episodes details and fan reactions
paragraph: Children’s series Bluey is set to thrill fans once again with a new collection of minisodes coming soon.

headline: Jessica Pegula will meet Aryna Sabalenka in the US Open women's final Saturday
paragraph: Jessica Pegula, seeded No. 6, will face No. 2 Aryna Sabalenka in the U.S. Open final. Pegula's journey to her first Grand Slam final at age 30 has been marked by injuries and setbacks. Her recent form includes a title in Toronto and a runner-up finish in Cincinnati.

headline: Praveen Kumar touches a new high: Tokyo silver medallist smashes Asian record with a 2.08m jump to clinch gold medal in Paris
paragraph: Praveen Kumar, a 2020 Tokyo silver medallist and 2023 Para Asian Games gold winner, secured a last-minute entry to the Paris Paralympics. He won gold in the men’s high jump T64 with an Asian record jump of 2.08m, surpassing his personal best and helping India achieve its sixth gold medal.

headline: Zepto in talks with investment banks for potential IPO next year
paragraph: The Mumbai-based startup is also talking to domestic investment banks for a potential listing of shares by August next year, one of the people said. Swiggy, the parent of Zepto’s rival Instamart, is also readying to hit the public market later this year with a $1.25 billion IPO. Its other bigger competitor, Blinkit, is owned by Zomato, a listed company since 2021.

headline: Revamp of Gati Shakti Cargo Terminal Policy in works to woo private players
paragraph: The Indian Railways is revising its Gati Shakti Cargo Terminal policy to boost private sector involvement in freight infrastructure. New guidelines will reduce costs for private developers, aiming to double the number of terminals. Some capital expenses will now be covered by the railways, making investments more attractive.

headline: Trump says, these things will happen if he is not elected as U.S President
paragraph: According to Donald Trump, there would be serious economic and social repercussions for the United States if he is not re-elected. Furthermore, he forewarned of possible interference with future elections and religious liberties.

headline: An orientation for IAS aspirants
paragraph: How many realise that a colonial era proscription had barred a section of Indians from the commonest ambition till 2018?

headline: Following Pooja Khedkar case, UPSC changes rulebook after getting over 30 similar complaints
paragraph: The Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) has received over 30 complaints alleging misrepresentation of credentials by selected candidates, following the Pooja Khedkar case. UPSC and the Department of Personnel & Training are investigating these claims and implementing stricter protocols to prevent future frauds. The government is also reviewing misuse of disability criteria and quota by candidates.

headline: Best Convection Microwaves in India to Savour Multiple Cuisines (2024)
paragraph: Are you looking for a convection microwave for your kitchen? If so, then continue reading this article to learn about the best convection microwaves in India. We have ensured to add every required detail about the ovens in this article to help you compare all of them with one another in order to find the best one for yourself. Once you know what to buy, you can place your order using the given buying links.

headline: 120 monuments claimed by state Waqf boards, says ASI
paragraph: The Parliamentary panel discussed the Waqf Amendment Bill with the ASI, which reported that over 120 protected monuments are claimed by state Waqf boards. This led to heated exchanges between ruling and Opposition members. The ASI presented a list of 53 monuments claimed by Waqf, some declared as such nearly a century after being protected.

headline: India set to review trade pact with Malaysia as deficit grows
paragraph: India is reviewing its trade agreement with Malaysia due to a rising trade deficit, which has doubled since 2011. The review will focus on rules of origin and non-tariff barriers. Major exports include petroleum products and aluminium, while key imports are vegetable oils and electronics. Consultations with industry sectors are planned.

headline: SC stays restoration of trials against Tamil Nadu ministers
paragraph: The Supreme Court has stayed a Madras High Court judgement that restored corruption cases against Tamil Nadu ministers KKSSR Ramachandran and Thangam Thenarasu. The court issued notice on their plea and asked the state and other respondents to file responses within four weeks. The Madras HC had previously set aside orders discharging the ministers and their wives.

headline: Summer of 2024 could be warmest ever measured
paragraph: Summer 2024 has been recorded as the hottest on Earth, surpassing last year's record. European climate service Copernicus attributes this to human-caused climate change and El Nino. The northern meteorological summer averaged 16.8 degrees Celsius, indicating a tightening grip of the climate crisis with severe weather impacts.

headline: Is CM Arvind Kejriwal prohibited from doing his duty from jail, asks SC
paragraph: The Supreme Court has questioned whether there is any restriction on Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal from performing his duties from jail. This inquiry follows delays in remission cases due to the lack of his signatures. The court seeks clarity as it affects numerous cases and will resume hearing on September 23.

headline: Third Eye: Caught in serial complaints, wait getting longer, all in the Family
paragraph: The Uttarakhand Congress unit is facing internal unrest with complaints against PCC president Karan Mahara. Despite recent by-election wins, the AICC is considering replacing him. Additionally, the release of the 79th round of the National Sample Survey is delayed. In Haryana, three related candidates from different parties are contesting the Dabwali assembly seat.

headline: Centre giving all help to flood-hit Andhra Pradesh and Telangana: Official
paragraph: The Centre is monitoring the flood situation in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana, with NDRF, IAF, and Indian Navy involved in relief operations. An inter-ministerial team will assess the damage. Home ministry official Sanjeev Kumar Jindal confirmed that central assistance is being provided to state governments for rescue efforts.

headline: RG Kar Hospital case: ED conducts multiple raids, detains one
paragraph: The Enforcement Directorate conducted multiple raids in Kolkata, Howrah, and other districts of West Bengal, targeting former RG Kar Medical College Principal Sandip Ghosh's residence. This is part of an investigation into alleged financial irregularities at the hospital. The ED has detained one person, while the CBI is also conducting a parallel probe.
